modules.description: This module calculates player rating updates based on game outcomes using the Glicko-2 algorithm. It processes a player's match results against opponents, applying win, loss, or draw outcomes to compute a new rating, deviation, and volatility. Functions handle both active rating updates and off-period adjustments, returning detailed error information when inputs are invalid.

This module calculates updated player ratings after a single game using the Glicko-2 algorithm. It takes two players and a game outcome, then returns new ratings based on the match result. It works with player records containing rating, deviation, and volatility, and is used to process individual game results in a rating system.

This module calculates updated player ratings after a single game using the Glicko-2 algorithm. It provides functions to create players with default parameters, compute new ratings based on game outcomes, and update inactive players. It works with player records containing rating, deviation, and volatility, and handles outcomes like wins, losses, or draws. Use it to adjust rankings in competitive games or tournaments where skill levels evolve over time.

This module implements the core Glicko2 rating calculations, handling player rating updates based on game outcomes. It operates on player and opponent records containing rating, deviation, and volatility, and processes results like win, lose, or draw against opponents. Use it to calculate updated ratings after a series of games or to apply the rating period inactivity adjustment.

Implements the Glicko-2 rating system with configurable parameters. It provides core calculations for updating player ratings based on game outcomes, handling player records with rating, deviation, and volatility. Use to compute updated ratings after multiple games or apply inactivity adjustments with custom configuration.

This module implements the Glicko-2 rating system with functions to update player ratings based on game outcomes. It works with player data containing rating, deviation, and volatility, and supports operations for both active matches and inactive periods. Use it to calculate skill rankings in competitive environments like online games or tournament systems.

Implements the Glicko-2 rating system with functions to update player ratings, deviations, and volatility based on match results and inactivity periods. Works with player data structures containing rating, deviation, and volatility values. Use to calculate and adjust skill rankings in competitive gaming or tournament environments.

This module defines core types and error variants for implementing the Glicko-2 rating system. It includes data structures for player attributes, rating calculations, and game outcomes, along with error handling specific to rating adjustments. It supports operations like player rating updates and game result processing, tailored for use in competitive ranking systems.
